name: ITP - CONOC Construction (Dunedin Airport) - Pavement Construction Area 1, 2, 3, 3A, 4 & 5

name: Accept / Reject Criteria - The Contractor to provide contract management plans as defined in the project specification prior to commencement of works. ITP to be reviewed and updated upon receipt of construction issue drawings/Specification.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to physical works
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Project Specification NTC / Email verification approving Contract Management Plans
Accept / Reject Criteria - Construction Pack including Site Specific Safety Plan developed for work area and issued to Engineer in advance of works.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to physical works 1 per site
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Downer/Construction Pack
Accept / Reject Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to Excavation 1 per site/work area
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Downer/Excavation Permit
Accept / Reject Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to Excavation as needed
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Downer/Internal Permits
Accept / Reject Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Airport Inductions, Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to Excavation as needed
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Downer/External Permits

Accept / Reject Criteria - Installation of geogrid/geocloth (A29/TX160) when instructed by Engineer. AP65 Compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Annually/Project
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - NZTA F/1, TNZ M/3 Notes/As per NZTA Specifications
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Supplied/approved annually by Engineer to Contract/Prior to AC
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Project Specification TNZ M/10:2020/Approved Mix Design
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Supplied/approved annually by ETC/Prior to AC
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Project Specification NZTA M32: 2021/Approved Mix Design
Accept / Reject Criteria - Standards pavement marking. Paint shall comply with TNZ M7 and shall be on the current Transit New Zealand list of approved paints.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Approved once by ETC/Prior to Line Marking
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Project Specification TNZ/LTSA (MOTSAM)/Approved pavement marking quality system

Accept / Reject Criteria - Unless shown otherwise on the drawings or directed by the Engineer, all vegetation, shrubs, trees under 3m in height, fences and foundations, retaining timbers, abandoned pipes and services, etc over the contract length and within the extent of the earthworks shall be removed off site.
○ All waste will be disposed at DIAL approved location.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Prior to Excavation/clearance works/per site
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Project Specification/Pre construction walkover inspection DNZ Field Inspection Record
Accept / Reject Criteria - Excavation carried out as per project extents detailed on construction issue drawings.
○ Level as per subgrade requirements below.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Per site specific requirements/as required
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - NZTA F1 DNZ Field Inspection Record
Accept / Reject Criteria - The Subgrade must be inspected by the Engineer following clearing and prior to the placement of any filling to confirm the strength of the underlying soils is sufficient.
○ Where Scala testing is deemed unsuitable by Contractor (hardfill or Service Strike Risk etc). Visual inspection by Engineer supersedes foundation testing requirements - Site instruction required.

○ Should material be determined as unsuitable (highly organic, saturated clay pug etc) Contractor to elevate to Engineer who will determine whether the material is unsuitable or not and agree the extent of the unsuitable material with the Contractor.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - 20m where practical
○ Not required for failed visual inspection areas (ie wet pug, highly organic material)/per site
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - NZTA F/1 Scala Report (CBR 5)
Accept / Reject Criteria - Installation of geogrid/geocloth (A29/TX160) as per design.
○ AP40 compacted in layer not exceeding 100mm, AP65 not exceeding 200mm and AP150 not exceeding 300mm.
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - NZTA F/1 TNZ M/3 Notes IANZ Lab Reports (on request)
Accept / Reject Criteria - Excavation Min 300mm from design lip level (road tie in) allowing for minimum 120mm M440 foundation for kerbs.
Frequency Of Inspection Or Test - Per site specific requirements/Project
Spec. Ref, Procedure Or Method Statement - Downer NZTA B/2:2005 DNZ Field Inspection Record
